snippet: A mile-by-mile look at the New York City Marathon ahead of the Nov. 4 race. Today: Mile 22 returns runners to Manhattan for the second-to-last stretch of the journey.
abstract: A mile-by-mile look at the New York City Marathon ahead of the Nov. 4 race. Today: Mile 22 returns runners to Manhattan for the second-to-last stretch of the journey.

headline.main: Mile 22: The Beginning of a Trek Down Fifth Avenue

snippet: Corrections appearing in print on October 31, 2012.
Ron Berger, the former top executive of Euro RSCG, teaches the new guard about old-fashioned brand-building.
abstract: Tanzina Vega Advertising column on former Euro RSCG executive Ron Berger, who is teaching new guard of advertising about old-fashioned brand building.

headline.main: Returning to Industry’s Roots With Lessons in Branding
headline.print_headline: Lessons in Branding Return to Industry’s Roots

snippet: A restaurant with open-faced sandwiches that are Denmark’s signature, pit-smoked barbecue in Brooklyn, and a restaurant reflecting the dishes of Provence.
abstract: Restaurants Aamanns-Copenhagen, Fletchers Brooklyn Barbecue, Krescendo, La Villette, L & W Oyster Co, Maison Harlem, Mayfield, The Quarter and Parlor Coffee open in New York City.

snippet: Tech companies have become interested in buying start-ups that specialize in security. The latest example is EMC, the data storage giant, which said Tuesday that it had acquired Silver Tail Systems, an antifraud start-up whose founders had worked ...
abstract: Tech companies have become interested in buying start-ups that specialize in security. The latest example is EMC, the data storage giant, which said Tuesday that it had acquired Silver Tail Systems, an antifraud start-up whose founders had worked on the antifraud teams at eBay and PayPal.

snippet: Also, Denzel Washington braved the storm on Monday to join David Letterman in Midtown Manhattan for the broadcast of "Late Show With David Lettrman."
abstract: Also, Denzel Washington braved the storm on Monday to join David Letterman in Midtown Manhattan for the broadcast of "Late Show With David Lettrman."

headline.main: The Breakfast Meeting: Publishing Consolidates, and Creeping 'Christmas Creep'

snippet: European media covered Hurricane Sandy as if it were a local story. Attention naturally focused on the impact on "iconic" New York, but some complained the coverage was excessive when compared to disasters elsewhere.
abstract: European media covered Hurricane Sandy as if it were a local story. Attention naturally focused on the impact on "iconic" New York, but some complained the coverage was excessive when compared to disasters elsewhere.

snippet: Even as Hurricane Sandy pounded the East Coast, the ouster of Scott Forstall at Apple roiled the tech world.
abstract: Even as Hurricane Sandy pounded the East Coast, the ouster of Scott Forstall at Apple roiled the tech world.

headline.main: Daily Report: A Shake-Up at Apple

snippet: The deal between the media companies Bertelsmann, which owns Random House, and Pearson, which owns Penguin, might draw antitrust scrutiny.
abstract: Announcement by Bertelsmann and Pearson that Random House and Penguin will merge ripples through the book publishing industry, possibly setting off a long-expected wave of consolidation as adaptations to the digital marketplace continue to transform the business.

headline.main: Random House and Penguin Merger Creates Global Giant
headline.print_headline: Random House And Penguin Merger Creates Global Giant

byline.original: By ERIC PFANNER and AMY CHOZICK
